title: Replace resume PDF with user-attached file to fix 'invalid PDF'

requirements.text: Replace the existing static resume PDF at the exact public path "/assets/resume/riya-tyagi-resume.pdf" (file: "frontend/public/assets/resume/riya-tyagi-resume.pdf") with the newly user-attached PDF so the downloaded/opened resume is a valid, readable PDF (not corrupted).
acceptanceCriteria: The file at "frontend/public/assets/resume/riya-tyagi-resume.pdf" is replaced with the newly attached PDF (byte-for-byte updated in the build output).
Clicking the "Download Resume" button in the Hero section downloads/opens "/assets/resume/riya-tyagi-resume.pdf" without any 'invalid PDF' error in common browser PDF viewers.
Opening the downloaded PDF in a desktop PDF reader (e.g., Adobe Reader/Preview) succeeds without corruption warnings.

constraints: Do not change the public resume URL; it must remain exactly "/assets/resume/riya-tyagi-resume.pdf" as referenced by the Hero section download logic.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No changes to Hero section layout, CTA labels, or resume download code unless strictly required to make the attached PDF open correctly.
